description: The CodeBoarding backend subsystem is a service-oriented architecture designed to bridge the gap between static analysis and interactive visualization. At its core, the Analysis Orchestrator manages the flow of data and commands, delegating the complex task of process execution to the Execution Lifecycle Manager. This manager leverages a Binary Runtime Resolver to ensure cross-platform compatibility. Once analysis is complete, the Analysis Data Repository works with the Graph Transformation Engine to hydrate the frontend with visualization-ready data. The Architectural Lookup Service completes the loop by providing the metadata necessary for linking physical source files back to their logical architectural components, facilitating a seamless "Code-to-Architecture" navigation experience.

components.name: Analysis Orchestrator
components.description: Central facade for the backend, coordinating extension commands, state management, and the lifecycle of analysis data.

components.name: Execution Lifecycle Manager
components.description: Manages the external analyzer process, including progress reporting, token usage monitoring, and centralized error handling.

components.name: Binary Runtime Resolver
components.description: Resolves platform-specific analyzer executables and prepares environment configurations for both production binaries and development scripts.

components.name: Analysis Data Repository
components.description: Orchestrates the persistence and retrieval of hierarchical analysis files, managing the transition between global and component-level views.

components.name: Architectural Lookup Service
components.description: Provides lookup logic to map source code file paths to their containing architectural components, enabling "direct code-to-diagram" navigation.

components.name: Graph Transformation Engine
components.description: Translates raw analyzer JSON/insights into the node-and-edge schema required by the visualization frontend.

components.name: Unclassified
components.description: Component for all unclassified files and utility functions (Utility functions/External Libraries/Dependencies)
